website_summaries.verdict: The Acer XB280HK is a 28-inch Ultra-High-Definition (UHD) monitor that utilizes Nvidia's G-Sync technology to deliver smooth gaming performance.

customer_reviews.title: OK product for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Not sure if the white-ish lines were there before, but when it's on and I'm turning on a game and the screen is black initially, I can see white stripes across the screen...only when completely black. When I'm watching something or gaming, I can't see it. So doesn't really bother me. Hope it won't get worse in the future as that would be a trouble.
customer_reviews.author: Stanislav Vasil

customer_reviews.title: having 5 1080p screens in front of me is wonderful. However its a TN panel so the viewing ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this primarily for productivity reasons - as a programmer, having 5 1080p screens in front of me is wonderful. However its a TN panel so the viewing angles are not the best (media is fine viewed head on though and black levels are very good) and, if I'm honest, 28" is just that tad too small for 4K productivity unless you have 20/20 eyesight. I'm looking forward to the 34" ultrawide QHD monitors dropping in price but I'm reasonably happy with this until they do.
customer_reviews.author: Lee J.

customer_reviews.title: Great screen
customer_reviews.text: Great screen. Only issues. Speakers are rubbish and it makes a slight noise when running. But I would buy again. However, my laptop has a 4K video card. If you don't have a 4K source don't buy this screen as it's only average when working at 1080p
customer_reviews.author: Handsomelad123

customer_reviews.title: Brill
customer_reviews.text: Had this monitor for 3 months now, used predominant for gaming and secondarily for procrastinating and watching videos. The screen is clearer than any other I have used, brilliant for gaming (played games such as Dota 2, GTA V, DayZ, NBA, Fifa, etc.) and i have had no issues thus far. If this changes i will edit my review accordingly but so far I haven't looked back :^)

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic display quality
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic display quality. Looks brilliant with DVI and HDMI. Adjustable stand has exceptional manoeuvrability. Only downfall is the lousy speaker system, but, nothing a speaker can't fix. Definitely reccomend for gaming and for immersive viewing.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Amazing delivery time of one day
customer_reviews.text: Amazing delivery time of one day. Very impressed. The screen is a joy, no ghosting fantastic colour reproduction out the box, really can't get better value for money. Love it! Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: William

customer_reviews.title: Decent for the price - Not for me
customer_reviews.text: Let me start off by saying this monitor is what i expected for the price. 4k provides excellent picture and more screen real estate. Colours were good for a TN but this monitor is not without problems. The biggest dealbreaker for me was ghosting, especially seeing as the monitor has an advertised 1ms response time. Coming from a samsung with a 5ms response time it seemed much less fluid. The audio pass through also didn't work but that wasn't an issue for me. For a good 4k experience, look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Sahir

customer_reviews.title: I do not recommend this monitor for anyone looking to spend 400 gbp
customer_reviews.text: Does not achieve 60hz when playing games. Screen tearing is evident at 40-60hz which makes me question its 1ms or the method it produces 60hz. Makes a low hiss noise even when the speakers are set to mute. Monitor turns off randomly for a few seconds at its own desire while am watching a movie or playing a game. I do not recommend this monitor for anyone looking to spend 400 gbp.
customer_reviews.author: ggproer

customer_reviews.title: Sharp and Vivid.
customer_reviews.text: I've had the Acer CB280HK for a couple weeks and it's connected to my Acer AG3-605 PC. The setup I have is dual screen, as indicated in the included photo (it's alongside a Samsung 26 inch), and it's main purpose is for photographic adjustments. It functions admirably in that respect as the image is sharp and the colors outstanding. Haven't experienced any issue but to soon to comment on longevity.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Oterson

customer_reviews.title: This monitor is great, stand is amazing and rugged
customer_reviews.text: Just got it. This monitor is great, stand is amazing and rugged. The picture quality and colours are fabulous. For using the OS and basic stuff it's fine. It would be the perfect monitor for me, however it introduces ghosting issues in gaming and fast moving scenes, objects moving from light to dark scenes which is very noticeable in things like GTA V playing in 4k, that's a big issue for gamers and probably some movie watchers, it may not bother some people. Also note the 60hz value is ONLY for the new DisplayPort 1.2 NOT the HDMI port which runs at 30hz.
customer_reviews.author: Some Dude
